model_answer: The most direct actions leading to finding a gold nugget were likely events C: Examining deep, gravel-filled crevices in the riverbed and D: Removing a large boulder blocking the way to search for gold, which allowed access to previously unexplored areas of the river.

The answer is A: Event 6: He retrieves a sizable gold nugget underwater and celebrates, even estimating its weight (audio) while showing it to the camera (visual). This event directly sets up the prospectors ability to weigh and showcase gold nuggets later in the day.
